title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, a Boston police officer since 1995, has died following a cancer diagnosis in 2025.
MacIsaac served in West Roxbury for 6 years and previously in Districts B-2, A-7, B-3, and C-6.
MacIsaac received commendations for his actions during the Boston Marathon bombings and several lifesaving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jeremy Swayman and Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a goalie fight during the outdoor Stadium Series game.
Over 64,000 fans watched as both goalies dropped gloves, earning major penalties in Boston’s 6-5 shootout loss.
Despite the skirmish, both goalies remained in the game, with Swayman recording 41 saves against Tampa Bay.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with the murder of Elizabeth and Nicholas Almeida in Fall River.
Cole faces two murder counts and one firearm possession count, per Bristol County District Attorney.
Police found Cole at the Barnes Street shooting scene; he had a relationship with Elizabeth Almeida.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, New Hampshire.
Fire departments from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford, along with police, coordinated a swift evacuation in under 90 minutes.
One person was treated at Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center; others were examined and returned to the lodge.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Massachusetts State Senator Dean Tran sentenced to 11 more months in prison for obstructing justice and making false statements.
Tran's sentence adds to his previous 18-month term for fraudulent pandemic unemployment benefits and tax return omissions.
Tran's legal issues include ethics violations and a gun theft incident where he intimidated an elderly woman.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month for January, scoring eight goals in 14 games for the Boston Bruins.
Minten contributed significantly to Bruins' 11-2-1 January record, tying for league lead with 14 points among rookies.
Acquired from Maple Leafs, Minten is first Bruins Rookie of the Month since March 2022, showing offensive promise.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The 72-foot fishing vessel Lily Jean sank off Gloucester, leaving seven crew members presumed dead as search efforts were suspended.
Captain Gus Sanfilippo, a fifth-generation fisherman featured on 'Nor’Easter Men', was among victims identified by family and friends.
Community mourns crew, including Salem native John Paul Rousanidis, Virginia observer Jada Samitt, and Marshfield resident Freeman Short.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for their Stadium Series game against the Lightning in Tampa.
Players donned tricorne hats and Revolutionary War-era attire, supplied by Boston Costume, reflecting Boston's historical ties.
The Lightning arrived in classic Tampa Bay Buccaneers uniforms, led by current Bucs players Baker Mayfield and Tristan Wirfs.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox with pitching prospect David Sandlin, reports say.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and sends cash to Chicago in return.
Hicks, with a $12.5 million contract for 2026, had a 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Red Sox.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Day 1 of the 'Something in the Way' music festival featured two dozen indie bands at Roadrunner.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured performances from bands like The Hotelier, February, and Tigers Jaw.
The festival lineup included diverse acts, ranging from emo to screamo, showcasing the indie music scene.
